definition: "ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
Xian Xinghai (1905-1945), violinist and composer, known for patriotic wartime pieces, including Yellow River Oratorio 黃河大合唱|黄河大合唱

sentences.english: Madame Xian Tai was the chief of the Baiyue ethnic group in the Lingnan region.
sentences.chinese: 冼夫人是嶺南百越族的一位首領。

sentences.english: This woman was named Lady Xian.
sentences.chinese: 這位女首領就是冼太夫人。

sentences.english: I asked Xian if he had thought about leaving the village after what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我問冼天全在發生這些事情後他有沒有想過離開村子。

sentences.english: Lady Xian lived during the Northern and Southern Dynasties, the most chaotic period in the history of ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 冼夫人餬口在中國汗青上最爲雜亂的南北朝時期。

sentences.english: Mr Sands said client income at the investment bank was up 20 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 冼博德表示，投資銀行業務的客戶收入增長了20%。

sentences.english: Sims will now finish eating gyros.

definition: camel/white horse with a black mane (archaic)
Li ethnic group of Hainan Province/surname Li/abbr. for Lebanon 黎巴嫩[Li2 ba1 nen4]
surname Ruan/small state during the Shang Dynasty (1600-1046 BC) located in the southeast of modern-day Gansu Province
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
